name: Saint Bear
descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) is a Russian-nexus threat actor active since early 2021, primarily targeting entities in Ukraine and Georgia. The group is notable for a specific remote access tool, [Saint Bot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1018), and information stealer, [OutSteel](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1017) in campaigns. [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) typically relies on phishing or web staging of malicious documents and related file types for initial access, spoofing government or related entities.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )(Citation: Cadet Blizzard emerges as novel threat actor) [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) has previously been confused with [Ember Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1003) operations, but analysis of behaviors, tools, and targeting indicates these are distinct clusters.

subtechniques.name: Web Services
subtechniques.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) has leveraged the Discord content delivery network to host malicious content for retrieval during initial access operations.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

technique_table_data.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter

subtechniques.name: PowerShell
subtechniques.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) relies extensively on PowerShell execution from malicious attachments and related content to retrieve and execute follow-on payloads.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

subtechniques.name: Windows Command Shell
subtechniques.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) initial loaders will also drop a malicious Windows batch file, available via open source GitHub repositories, that disables Microsoft Defender functionality.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

subtechniques.name: JavaScript
subtechniques.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) has delivered malicious Microsoft Office files containing an embedded JavaScript object that would, on execution, download and execute [OutSteel](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1017) and [Saint Bot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1018).(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

technique_table_data.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) has used the Windows Script Host (wscript) to execute intermediate files written to victim machines.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation for Client Execution
technique_table_data.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) has leveraged vulnerabilities in client applications such as CVE-2017-11882 in Microsoft Office to enable code execution in victim environments.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

subtechniques.name: Email Addresses
subtechniques.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) gathered victim email information in advance of phishing operations for targeted attacks.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

subtechniques.name: Disable or Modify Tools
subtechniques.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) will modify registry entries and scheduled task objects associated with Windows Defender to disable its functionality.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

technique_table_data.name: Impersonation
technique_table_data.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) has impersonated government and related entities in both phishing activity and developing web sites with malicious links that mimic legitimate resources.(Citation: Cadet Blizzard emerges as novel threat actor)

technique_table_data.name: Modify Registry
technique_table_data.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) will leverage malicious Windows batch scripts to modify registry values associated with Windows Defender functionality.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

subtechniques.name: Software Packing
subtechniques.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) clones .NET assemblies from other .NET binaries as well as cloning code signing certificates from other software to obfuscate the initial loader payload.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

subtechniques.name: Encrypted/Encoded File
subtechniques.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) initial payloads included encoded follow-on payloads located in the resources file of the first-stage loader.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
subtechniques.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) uses a variety of file formats, such as Microsoft Office documents, ZIP archives, PDF documents, and other items as phishing attachments for initial access.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

subtechniques.name: Upload Malware
subtechniques.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) has used the Discord content delivery network for hosting malicious content referenced in links and emails.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

subtechniques.name: Code Signing
subtechniques.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) has used an initial loader malware featuring a legitimate code signing certificate associated with "Electrum Technologies GmbH."(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

subtechniques.name: Malicious Link
subtechniques.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) has, in addition to email-based phishing attachments, used malicious websites masquerading as legitimate entities to host links to malicious files for user execution.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )(Citation: Cadet Blizzard emerges as novel threat actor)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) relies on user interaction and execution of malicious attachments and similar for initial execution on victim systems.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

technique_table_data.name: Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion
technique_table_data.descr: [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) contains several anti-analysis and anti-virtualization checks.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

software_data.name: OutSteel
software_data.descr: [OutSteel](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1017) is uniquely associated with [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) as a post-exploitation document collection and exfiltration tool.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

techniques.name: Masquerading
techniques.sub_name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location

software_data.name: Saint Bot
software_data.descr: [Saint Bot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1018) is closely correlated with [Saint Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1031) operations as a common post-exploitation toolset.(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )

techniques.name: Masquerading
techniques.sub_name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location

Cadet Blizzard emerges as novel threat a.description: Microsoft Threat Intelligence. (2023, June 14). Cadet Blizzard emerges as a novel and distinct Russian threat actor. Retrieved July 10, 2023.

Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot Febr.description: Unit 42. (2022, February 25). Spear Phishing Attacks Target Organizations in Ukraine, Payloads Include the Document Stealer OutSteel and the Downloader SaintBot. Retrieved June 9, 2022.
